docs.snippet: IN the Western Hemisphere a 400th anniversary for a city is a rare event, and so Rio de Janeiro is celebrating its quatercentenary in 1965 off and on all year.

headline.main: On the Railroad Named Delight; Commuters in Rio de Janeiro gripe about it, but they love their city on its 400th anniversary. On the Railroad Named Delight

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 6 -- The body of a suspected Nazi war criminal was found by the police today in a trunk in a fashionable home on the outskirts of this city.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 6 -- The body of a suspected Nazi war criminal was found by the police today in a trunk in a fashionable home on the outskirts of this city.
docs.abstract: Body of man identified as H Cukurz, 'executed' by Those Who Can Never Forget (orgn) for role in shipment of Jews from Riga to extermination camps, found in trunk, Montevideo, Uruguay

headline.main: Uruguayans Find Trunk With Body Of Suspected Nazi

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 7 -- Past the halfway mark of a South American tour. George Moore, president of the First National City Bank of New York, is confident that the eight-nation Latin-American Free Trade Association will be able to move more...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, March 7 -- Past the halfway mark of a South American tour. George Moore, president of the First National City Bank of New York, is confident that the eight-nation Latin-American Free Trade Association will be able to move more decisively toward economic integration in the near future.

headline.main: BANKER DISCERNS LATIN-BLOC GAINS; President of City Bank Cites Strides Toward Unity BANKER DISCERNS LATIN-BLOC GAINS

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 8 (UPI) -- The police said tonight that a thumb print from the body found in a trunk in a suburban Montevideo villa matches the print in the passport of Herberts Cukurz, a former Nazi.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 8 (UPI) -- The police said tonight that a thumb print from the body found in a trunk in a suburban Montevideo villa matches the print in the passport of Herberts Cukurz, a former Nazi.

headline.main: Uruguay Identifies Ex-Nazi As Slain Man, Ending Doubt

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 9 (UPI) -- The police said today that an Israeli Government employe was involved in the slaying here of Herbert Albert Cukurs, a Latvian-born former Nazi wanted for alleged war crimes.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, March 9 (UPI) -- The police said today that an Israeli Government employe was involved in the slaying here of Herbert Albert Cukurs, a Latvian-born former Nazi wanted for alleged war crimes.
docs.abstract: link unnamed Israeli Govt employe to slaying; say kidnapping was originally planned; wave of anti-Semitism follows slaying

headline.main: Israeli Aide Is Linked to Killing Of Latvian Nazi in Montevideo

docs.snippet: Herbert Albert Cukurs has been one of the names on the wanted list at West Germany's central agency for the uncovering of Nazi crimes. The charge against him has been that as a member of the Latvian SS he supervised the mass killings of some 32,000...
docs.lead_paragraph: Herbert Albert Cukurs has been one of the names on the wanted list at West Germany's central agency for the uncovering of Nazi crimes. The charge against him has been that as a member of the Latvian SS he supervised the mass killings of some 32,000 Jews in Latvia and Lithuania during 1940 and 1941.
